title: Trends in Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning (CSCL) Research and Socioconstructivist Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental concepts of collaborative learning and experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Learners prepare for professional careers (medical/legal/technical) while exploring collaborative learning strategies applicable to real-world settings. The environment is optimized for mobile-based activities using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can analyze CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) research trends and explain nine core themes (three high-density, three medium-density, three low-density).
Learners can apply principles of designing collaborative learning environments based on a social constructivist approach to real-world cases.
Learners can propose strategies for utilizing digital tools to manage large-scale collaborative projects in mobile microlearning environments.

resources: Summary of Scopus Database Analysis Results
Mobile App for Experiencing Collaborative Learning Platforms
Topic-based CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) Case Database

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
